name: Blackboard Learn
description: Drexel's platform for online course delivery and management software. Instructors can use Learn to deliver online course materials, or deliver completely online courses. Features discussion boards, grading tools, test administrations tools, document delivery, and much more. Students can sign in to access course materials posted by the instructor.

name: ArcGIS
description: A Web-based tool from the geographic information system market leader ESRI with demographic and business data visualized in map format, as well as graphed or exportable as raw spreadsheet data.
support_team: Departmental Tech Support or IT Help Desk

name: GIMP
description: Image editing and manipulation program similar to Photoshop.

name: Degree Works
description: DegreeWorks is an online tool available to undergraduate students. DegreeWorks allows you to track your progress towards the completion of your degree program, including the number of credits you have earned and still need to complete, GPA status, and course requirements for your program. It is recommended that you use DegreeWorks in coordination with regular consultation with your academic advisor.

name: McGraw-Hill Connect
description: An online service for instructors and strudents to streamline education.  Instructors can manage homework and quiz/exam distribution and grading; students can fill out and submit the materials the instructors provide.  Students are able to learn and watch videos on the topics as well as read the course's textbook.

name: Zoom
description: Video-conferencing application for business meetings. Licensed at Drexel for faculty, professional staff, and students.

name: Tux
description: CCI maintains a compute environment to support class requirements. Typically referred to as Tux, this environment provides various services.
